story.storybody:
From a modest beginning as a 100-bed charitable hospital in Ferozepur district of Punjab, Indus Hospital has grown over the years and is presently running two hospitals, a diagnostic laboratory and a day care clinic in Mohali. Under the chairmanship of Dr S.P. Singh, the Indus Hospital runs the 100-bedded Indus Super Specialty Hospital in Phase I, Mohali, besides the 50-bed Indus Hospital in Phase 3B2 of Mohali. {mosimage}

The Indus Scan Laboratory--a diagnostic lab in Phase 3B2, Mohali, boasts of advanced radio diagnostic equipments and offers CT Scan, ultrasound, digital X-ray and Doppler study. Stressing on the going demand for cosmetic procedures among people, Dr Vandana Sharma, the 33-year-old, Director, administration of Indus Hospital, told Simply punjabi that the Indus Hygiea, in Phase VI, Mohali, is a one-stop destination for all body, beauty and life style needs which are taken care of by a team of expert doctors.

It offers its clientele, modern, hightech and advanced services in dental and skin care, both cosmetic and plastic surgery. The facilities available at Indus Hygiea include breast augmentation, liposuction, tummy tuck, face and neck lifts, rhinoplasty (nose surgery), blepharoplasty (eye lid and hair transplant), Dr Sharma added.

Indus Hospital has two new projects in Fatehgarh Sahib and Dera Bassi, which will be providing a total of 460 beds. The Indus Fatehgarh Sahib Hospital would be dedicated to mother and child healthcare. The second project will be the Indus International Hospital which would have 250 beds in the first phase and in the second phase the bed strength would go up to 500.

The hospital would provide tertiary level care to the people of neighboring states of Punjab, Haryana, Himachal, Jammu and Kashmir, and Uttrakhand as well as patients from other areas along with a team of highly experienced team of doctors on its rolls.
